org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact

Class ContactConstraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.dynamics.Constraint
      • org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact.ContactConstraint

  • public class ContactConstraint
extends Constraint
    Represents a Contact constraint for each Body pair.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.1
    Author:
    William Bittle

                 BodyFixture fixture1,
                 Body body2,
                 BodyFixture fixture2,
                 Manifold manifold,
                 World world)
        Full constructor.
        Parameters:
        body1 - the first Body
        fixture1 - the first Body's BodyFixture
        body2 - the second Body
        fixture2 - the second Body's BodyFixture
        manifold - the contact Manifold
        world - the World this contact constraint belongs to

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Constraint

      • shiftCoordinates

        protected void shiftCoordinates(Vector2 shift)
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Shifts (translates) the coordinates of this constraint.

        Typically this method should not be called directly. Instead use the World.shiftCoordinates(Vector2) method to move the entire world.

        Specified by:
        shiftCoordinates in class Constraint
        Parameters:
        shift - the distance to shift along the x and y axes

        public boolean isSensor()
        Returns true if this ContactConstraint is a sensor.
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        1.0.1

      • setSensor

        public void setSensor(boolean flag)
        Sets this contact constraint to a sensor if flag is true.

        A sensor constraint is not solved.

        Parameters:
        flag - true if this contact constraint should be a sensor
        Since:
        3.0.2

      • getTangentSpeed

        public double getTangentSpeed()
        Returns the surface speed of the contact manifold.

        This can be used to simulate a conveyor belt.

        Returns:
        double
        Since:
        3.0.2

      • setTangentSpeed

        public void setTangentSpeed(double speed)
        Sets the surface speed of the contact manifold.

        The surface speed, in meters / second, is used to simulate a conveyor belt.

        A value of zero deactivates this feature.

        Parameters:
        speed - the speed in Meters / Second
        Since:
        3.0.2
